RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Claiming Purse 11500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KEEPMEINPOWER trailed the field early, angled inside at the head of the stretch, drove three-wide taking over, and edged clear. SMOKIN JOY chased the early pacesetters from a rail position, shifted out to the four path leaving the backstretch, rallied five wide midstretch, and was along in time for second. GOLDIE SOCKS quickly went to the front, set a pressured pace in the three path, dueled outside of STARLIGHT LANE in the final turn, gained a slim advantage in the stretch but was caught late. DARLA'S FURY was fractious in the gate dismounting the rider, was reserved off the dueling pacesetters, rallied belatedly and finished in a dead heat alongside STARLIGHT LANE. STARLIGHT LANE pressed the pace from the two path, contested the lead into the final turn then continued to battle on inside through the stretch and weakened midstretch finishing on the wire at the same time as DARLA'S FURY. WICKED WIZZY saved ground inside and failed to threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Keepmeinpower
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, angled inside, drove 3w, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Goldie Socks
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, dueled outside, caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 19500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING $17,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $ 22,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAILWAY saved ground while setting the pace, responded to a looming threat from KYSTONE near the three-sixteenth pole, was kept under steady handling while under pressure late and held firm. KYSTONE sat in striking position along the rail, moved up menacingly after the quarter pole, and kept on determinedly but was unable to reach the winner. BARE BACK JACK sat just off the pace from the three path, hustled four wide off the final turn, and finished evenly. PARKING PERMIT was never far back but failed to threaten. MACHINE offered a mild bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Parking Permit
ENTRY.OWNER: Hurley Racing Stable and Walper, Deanna

ENTRY.NAME: Kystone
ENTRY.OWNER: Empire Equestrian Kerredge Farm Stock Curtis McPherson Cam and Lenheiser Ray

ENTRY.NAME: Railway
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, steady handling, held firm

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Joe B. Mulholland Jr., John P.Mulholland & Karen Mulhollan

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CTHS Sales Colts and Geldings Division S. CENTURY MILE RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 86. Stakes Purse 50000. A SALE STAKE FOR THREE AND FOUR YEAR OLD CANADIAN BRED COLTS AND GELDINGS. Any Canadian bred yearling that passed through the CTHS Alberta Division sales ring a buyer's fee of $200 over and above the purchase price of the yearling must be paid by the pur chaser at the time of sale in order to be eligible for the 2023 3 and 4YO restricted Sales Stake. Qualifying CTHS Alberta Sale graduates have at minimum 5 guaranteed entries for the race are free to nominate, $500 to enter and $500 to start. Any Canadianb red that passed through the CTHS (MB), CTHS (BC) or CTHS (ON) sales ring is also eligible provided that the $750 nomination fee is paid at the time of nomination, the $750 entry fee to pass the entry box and $1,000 to start is paid. AB Sales Graduates arr e Preferred. Second preference is given by earnings in 2023. Weight: 123 lbs Three-Year-Olds. 126 lbs Older. Field limited to Ten Starters and four also eligible. Purse distribution: 1st- 60%, 2nd- 20%, 3rd -10%, 4th- 3.5%, 5th- 2.5%, 6th- 2%, CTHS (Alb
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ASYOUBELIEVE showed the way from the two path, remained unchallenged at the head of the lane, extended his advantage under a confident hand ride and was wrapped up late. ITSMYDAY lagged leaving, gained closer order in the far turn, met traffic near the quarter pole, and was gaining late but no real threat to the winner. PADDYS ROCKET sat just off the pace while five wide, chased through the stretch and evened out for show. AMUSING WAY found himself in the middle of the track entering the backstretch, remained wide then angled to the five path into the far turn, and came up empty for the drive. KISS ME HELLO was under a snug hold when leaving the chute then settled inside, and was unable to make an impact late.

ENTRY.NAME: Asyoubelieve
ENTRY.OWNER: Shot In The Dark Racing Corp.

ENTRY.NAME: Paddys Rocket
ENTRY.OWNER: Elsener Terry Brown James R and Konyk Jr Bill

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Special Weight Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SILKSTONE hurried away, gave chased inside, took over at the head of the stretch, and won driving. BIRDY'S ON FIRE vied inside, emerged the leader leaving the backstretch, rallied between but was overtaken and just held for second. SKIPPER'S PRIDE broke outward, gained closer order then uncorked a late bid just missing out on place. ASAMATTEROFFACTIDO sent for speed, moved up alongside BIRDY'S ON FIRE leaving the backstretch, drove three wide into the stretch and weakened in the final sixteenth. DARE TO COMPARE broke in sharply then started bucking racing greenly in the backstretch, and faded. EL CORRECAMINOS offered a late mild bid. E PAY ALL THE WAY was outrun throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Birdy's On Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, led, rallied between, just held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Silkstone
ENTRY.OWNER: Everblack Cattle Co Ltd Stetson Enterprises Ltd and Stetson Ryan

ENTRY.NAME: Asamatteroffactido
ENTRY.OWNER: Dialed In Racing Stable and Graham Thoroughbreds

ENTRY.NAME: Dare to Compare
ENTRY.OWNER: Barker Jim Barker Carole and Red Ron Farms

ENTRY.NAME: Skipper's Pride
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outward, gained, late inside bid, missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CTHS Sales S. CENTURY MILE RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 88. Stakes Purse 50000. A SALE STAKE FOR THREE AND FOUR YEAR OLD CANADIAN BRED FILLIES & MARES. Any Canadian bred yearling that passed through the CTHS Alberta Division sales ring a buyer's fee of $200 over and above the purchase price of the yearling must be paid by the purcha ser at the time of sale in order to be eligible for the 2023 3 and 4YO restricted Fillies & Mares Sales Stake. Qualifying CTHS Alberta Sale graduates have at minimum 5 guaranteed entries for the race are free to nominate, $500 to enter and $500 to start.A ny Canadian bred that passed through the CTHS (MB), CTHS (BC) or CTHS (ON) sales ring is also eligible provided that the $750 nomination fee is paid at the time of nomination, the $750 entry fee to pass the entry box and $1,000 to start is paid. AB Saless Graduates are Preferred. Second preference is given by earnings in 2023. Weight: 123 lbs Three-Year-Olds. 126 lbs Older. Field limited to Ten Starters and four also eligible. Purse distribution: 1st- 60%, 2nd- 20%, 3rd -10%, 4th- 3.5%, 5th- 2.5%, 6th-
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIG HUG took back leaving the chute, tracked three wide, moved up into striking position nearing the quarter pole, gained the lead then drifted out then dug in, in the final strides to take the nod. JELLI lagged early, gained ground quickly near the five-sixteenth pole, closed outside under left-handed encouragement, then ducked inside, and was out-finished. SKIP'S ROCK settled in stride away from the gate then was soon joined to contend the early lead by BOOTIFUL ROSE, departed from rival nearing the quarter pole but had no response when challenged into the stretch and evened out. SHAMRA saved ground and lacked the kick needed. STEVIE WONDER GIRL tracked the dueling pacesetters and faded steadily inside. BOOTIFUL ROSE contested the early pace, was unable to move on with her rival, and yielded. STEWARDS INQUIRY- The Stewards conducted an inquiry into the stretch run of the race but made no change. JOCKEY OBJECTION- An objection lodged by the rider of JELLI against the rider of BIG HUG alleging interference in the stretch run was not allowed after review by the Board of Stewards.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Hug
ENTRY.COMMENT: took back, tracked 3w, gained, drifted out, won nod

ENTRY.NAME: Jelli
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged early, gained, closed outside, out finished

ENTRY.NAME: Bootiful Rose
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Knight Don

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 12500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD NON-WINNERS OF 2 RACES SINCE AUGUST 5, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250 (Lesser Claimin g Races For $6,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). Alberta Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CAPA BELLA prompted along from a rail position, gained an advantage nearing the quarter pole, turned back a challenge from TALA, and drew clear. TALA tracked the early pacesetters while five wide, found seam at the quarter pole then moved up menacingly but was unable to get by and finished with good energy for second. SAVYSKYE away well then set a pressured pace from the five path, fanned three wide into the far turn, tipped out five wide at the head of the lane and stayed on for show. AMBER PRINCESS unhurried early, and bid belatedly. LETS GO ALL THEWAY rated off the pace from a rail position, and faded. CUVEE TEE broke awkwardly then hurried up between foes, and had nothing left in reserve for the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Capa Bella
ENTRY.OWNER: Hanna Mike W Hardy Lesley Prolift Crane Robertson Jerri R and B First Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Amber Princess
ENTRY.OWNER: Fontaine Miranda and Ross Morrison Farms

ENTRY.NAME: Savyskye
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace 5w, fanned 3w, tipped 5w, stayed on 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Martin Deerline Juvenile S. CENTURY MILE RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR TWO-YEAR-OLDS. A fee of $100.00 required to nominate. A payment of $500.00 is required to pass the entry box and an additional $400.00 is required to start. The purse will be divided $30,000 to the owner of the winner, $10,000 to the second place fini sher, $5,000 to the third place finisher, $2,500 to the fourth place finisher and $1,000 to the fifth place finisher. A payment of $500 will be paid to all horses who start and finish 6th or worse. Starters to be named through the entry box by the closing time of entries. The field will be limited to 12 starters. Preference will be given to those horses with the highest earnings. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Colts and Geldings : 122 lbs. Fillies : 119lbs. Maidens allowed 3 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THUNDER ROARS raced five wide into the opening turn, closed steadily outside, overtook the lead, and won going away. TIPSY TALES brushed leaving, contested the lead from between foes in the far turn, rallied inside of ITSALLGOODMAN at the head of the lane, inched clear, and held for second. ITSALLGOODMAN stumbled from the gate brushing inside foe, fanned three-wide in the far turn, was urged on outside TIPSY TALES and weakened deep stretch. GRATED COCONUT gave chased inside, went five to six wide out of the final turn but was unable to make an impact late. HE LIKES WINNING lacked the early speed needed, and lodged a late mild bid. PATRIOTIC FREEDOM trailed early, and passed tiring foes. JAKOBS ROCKET BOY vied hard outside then crossed over to the two path leaving the backstretch, was overtaken and faded gradually. DOUG'S HERO hurried away, chased and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Thunder Roars
ENTRY.OWNER: C and H Duggan Farms Ltd

ENTRY.NAME: Tipsy Tales
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed, contested between, inched clear, held 2nd
